page.title: 07NEWER AYLESFORD
page.content: The riverside village attracts many tourists and artists.The fruit orchards draw visitors in spring for local blossom tours. The Garden of England also attracts people at harvest time to purchase fruit.The Alms Houses,properly known as the Hospital of the Holy Trinity were built in 1605 to house 6 people but restored during the 19th century now house 16.The houses are shortly to be renovated but the orginal facade including stained glass windows a sundial and an old pump will remian.A fountain in the village square has been restored and reset.The Carmelite Priory founded in 1242,dissolved by Henry 8th and turned into a private house was visited by Samuel Pepys. Gutted by fire it was purchased by Carmelites in 1949 & restored to a holy shrine visited by many.
